comment:
* Describes the cause of a disconnected call. Those disconnect causes can be converted into a more
 * generic {@link android.telecom.DisconnectCause} object.
 *
 * Used in {@link PhoneStateListener#onCallDisconnectCauseChanged}.

variables.name: NOT_VALID
variables.comment: The disconnect cause is not valid (Not received a disconnect cause)

variables.name: NOT_DISCONNECTED
variables.comment: Has not yet disconnected

variables.name: INCOMING_MISSED
variables.comment: An incoming call that was missed and never answered

variables.name: NORMAL
variables.comment: Normal; Remote hangup

variables.name: LOCAL
variables.comment: Normal; Local hangup

variables.name: BUSY
variables.comment: Outgoing call to busy line

variables.name: CONGESTION
variables.comment: Outgoing call to congested network

variables.name: MMI
variables.comment: Not presently used

variables.name: INVALID_NUMBER
variables.comment: Invalid dial string

variables.name: NUMBER_UNREACHABLE
variables.comment: Cannot reach the peer

variables.name: SERVER_UNREACHABLE
variables.comment: Cannot reach the server

variables.name: INVALID_CREDENTIALS
variables.comment: Invalid credentials

variables.name: OUT_OF_NETWORK
variables.comment: Calling from out of network is not allowed

variables.name: SERVER_ERROR
variables.comment: Server error

variables.name: TIMED_OUT
variables.comment: Client timed out

variables.name: LOST_SIGNAL
variables.comment: Client went out of network range

variables.name: LIMIT_EXCEEDED
variables.comment: GSM or CDMA ACM limit exceeded

variables.name: INCOMING_REJECTED
variables.comment: An incoming call that was rejected

variables.name: POWER_OFF
variables.comment: Radio is turned off explicitly

variables.name: OUT_OF_SERVICE
variables.comment: Out of service

variables.name: ICC_ERROR
variables.comment: No ICC, ICC locked, or other ICC error

variables.name: CALL_BARRED
variables.comment: Call was blocked by call barring

variables.name: FDN_BLOCKED
variables.comment: Call was blocked by fixed dial number

variables.name: CS_RESTRICTED
variables.comment: Call was blocked by restricted all voice access

variables.name: CS_RESTRICTED_NORMAL
variables.comment: Call was blocked by restricted normal voice access

variables.name: CS_RESTRICTED_EMERGENCY
variables.comment: Call was blocked by restricted emergency voice access

variables.name: UNOBTAINABLE_NUMBER
variables.comment: Unassigned number

variables.name: CDMA_LOCKED_UNTIL_POWER_CYCLE
variables.comment: MS is locked until next power cycle

variables.name: CDMA_DROP
variables.comment: Drop call

variables.name: CDMA_INTERCEPT
variables.comment: INTERCEPT order received, MS state idle entered

variables.name: CDMA_REORDER
variables.comment: MS has been redirected, call is cancelled

variables.name: CDMA_SO_REJECT
variables.comment: Service option rejection

variables.name: CDMA_RETRY_ORDER
variables.comment: Requested service is rejected, retry delay is set

variables.name: CDMA_ACCESS_FAILURE
variables.comment: Unable to obtain access to the CDMA system

variables.name: CDMA_PREEMPTED
variables.comment: Not a preempted call

variables.name: CDMA_NOT_EMERGENCY
variables.comment: Not an emergency call

variables.name: CDMA_ACCESS_BLOCKED
variables.comment: Access Blocked by CDMA network

variables.name: ERROR_UNSPECIFIED
variables.comment: Unknown error or not specified

variables.name: EMERGENCY_ONLY
variables.comment: TODO: This should be the same as NOT_EMERGENCY

variables.name: NO_PHONE_NUMBER_SUPPLIED
variables.comment: * The supplied CALL Intent didn't contain a valid phone number.

variables.name: DIALED_MMI
variables.comment: * Our initial phone number was actually an MMI sequence.

variables.name: VOICEMAIL_NUMBER_MISSING
variables.comment: * We tried to call a voicemail: URI but the device has no voicemail number configured.

variables.name: CDMA_CALL_LOST
variables.comment:
* This status indicates that InCallScreen should display the
     * CDMA-specific "call lost" dialog.  (If an outgoing call fails,
     * and the CDMA "auto-retry" feature is enabled, *and* the retried
     * call fails too, we display this specific dialog.)
     *
     * TODO: this is currently unused, since the "call lost" dialog
     * needs to be triggered by a *disconnect* event, rather than when
     * the InCallScreen first comes to the foreground.  For now we use
     * the needToShowCallLostDialog field for this (see below.)
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: EXITED_ECM
variables.comment:
* This status indicates that the call was placed successfully,
     * but additionally, the InCallScreen needs to display the
     * "Exiting ECM" dialog.
     *
     * (Details: "Emergency callback mode" is a CDMA-specific concept
     * where the phone disallows data connections over the cell
     * network for some period of time after you make an emergency
     * call.  If the phone is in ECM and you dial a non-emergency
     * number, that automatically *cancels* ECM, but we additionally
     * need to warn the user that ECM has been canceled (see bug
     * 4207607.))
     *
     * TODO: Rethink where the best place to put this is. It is not a notification
     * of a failure of the connection -- it is an additional message that accompanies
     * a successful connection giving the user important information about what happened.
     *
     * {@hide}

variables.name: OUTGOING_FAILURE
variables.comment: * The outgoing call failed with an unknown cause.

variables.name: OUTGOING_CANCELED
variables.comment: * The outgoing call was canceled by the {@link android.telecom.ConnectionService}.

variables.name: IMS_MERGED_SUCCESSFULLY
variables.comment: * The call, which was an IMS call, disconnected because it merged with another call.

variables.name: DIAL_MODIFIED_TO_USSD
variables.comment: * Stk Call Control modified DIAL request to USSD request.

variables.name: DIAL_MODIFIED_TO_SS
variables.comment: * Stk Call Control modified DIAL request to SS request.

variables.name: DIAL_MODIFIED_TO_DIAL
variables.comment: * Stk Call Control modified DIAL request to DIAL with modified data.

variables.name: CDMA_ALREADY_ACTIVATED
variables.comment: * The call was terminated because CDMA phone service and roaming have already been activated.

variables.name: VIDEO_CALL_NOT_ALLOWED_WHILE_TTY_ENABLED
variables.comment:
* The call was terminated because it is not possible to place a video call while TTY is
     * enabled.

variables.name: CALL_PULLED
variables.comment: * The call was terminated because it was pulled to another device.

variables.name: ANSWERED_ELSEWHERE
variables.comment: * The call was terminated because it was answered on another device.

variables.name: MAXIMUM_NUMBER_OF_CALLS_REACHED
variables.comment: * The call was terminated because the maximum allowable number of calls has been reached.

variables.name: DATA_DISABLED
variables.comment:
* The call was terminated because cellular data has been disabled.
     * Used when in a video call and the user disables cellular data via the settings.

variables.name: DATA_LIMIT_REACHED
variables.comment:
* The call was terminated because the data policy has disabled cellular data.
     * Used when in a video call and the user has exceeded the device data limit.

variables.name: DIALED_CALL_FORWARDING_WHILE_ROAMING
variables.comment:
* The call being placed was detected as a call forwarding number and was being dialed while
     * roaming on a carrier that does not allow this.

variables.name: IMEI_NOT_ACCEPTED
variables.comment:
* The network does not accept the emergency call request because IMEI was used as
     * identification and this cability is not supported by the network.

variables.name: WIFI_LOST
variables.comment:
* A call over WIFI was disconnected because the WIFI signal was lost or became too degraded to
     * continue the call.

variables.name: IMS_ACCESS_BLOCKED
variables.comment: * The call has failed because of access class barring.

variables.name: LOW_BATTERY
variables.comment: * The call has ended (mid-call) because the device's battery is too low.

variables.name: DIAL_LOW_BATTERY
variables.comment: * A call was not dialed because the device's battery is too low.

variables.name: EMERGENCY_TEMP_FAILURE
variables.comment: * Emergency call failed with a temporary fail cause and can be redialed on this slot.

variables.name: EMERGENCY_PERM_FAILURE
variables.comment:
* Emergency call failed with a permanent fail cause and should not be redialed on this
     * slot.

variables.name: NORMAL_UNSPECIFIED
variables.comment:
* This cause is used to report a normal event only when no other cause in the normal class
     * applies.

variables.name: DIAL_MODIFIED_TO_DIAL_VIDEO
variables.comment: * Stk Call Control modified DIAL request to video DIAL request.

variables.name: DIAL_VIDEO_MODIFIED_TO_SS
variables.comment: * Stk Call Control modified Video DIAL request to SS request.

variables.name: DIAL_VIDEO_MODIFIED_TO_USSD
variables.comment: * Stk Call Control modified Video DIAL request to USSD request.

variables.name: DIAL_VIDEO_MODIFIED_TO_DIAL
variables.comment: * Stk Call Control modified Video DIAL request to DIAL request.

variables.name: DIAL_VIDEO_MODIFIED_TO_DIAL_VIDEO
variables.comment: * Stk Call Control modified Video DIAL request to Video DIAL request.

variables.name: IMS_SIP_ALTERNATE_EMERGENCY_CALL
variables.comment:
* The network has reported that an alternative emergency number has been dialed, but the user
     * must exit airplane mode to place the call.

variables.name: ALREADY_DIALING
variables.comment:
* Indicates that a new outgoing call cannot be placed because there is already an outgoing
     * call dialing out.

variables.name: CANT_CALL_WHILE_RINGING
variables.comment: * Indicates that a new outgoing call cannot be placed while there is a ringing call.

variables.name: CALLING_DISABLED
variables.comment:
* Indicates that a new outgoing call cannot be placed because calling has been disabled using
     * the ro.telephony.disable-call system property.

variables.name: TOO_MANY_ONGOING_CALLS
variables.comment:
* Indicates that a new outgoing call cannot be placed because there is currently an ongoing
     * foreground and background call.

variables.name: OTASP_PROVISIONING_IN_PROCESS
variables.comment:
* Indicates that a new outgoing call cannot be placed because OTASP provisioning is currently
     * in process.

variables.name: MEDIA_TIMEOUT
variables.comment:
* Indicates that the call is dropped due to RTCP inactivity, primarily due to media path
     * disruption.

variables.name: EMERGENCY_CALL_OVER_WFC_NOT_AVAILABLE
variables.comment:
* Indicates that an emergency call cannot be placed over WFC because the service is not
     * available in the current location.

variables.name: WFC_SERVICE_NOT_AVAILABLE_IN_THIS_LOCATION
variables.comment: * Indicates that WiFi calling service is not available in the current location.

variables.name: OUTGOING_EMERGENCY_CALL_PLACED
variables.comment:
* Indicates that an emergency call was placed, which caused the existing connection to be
     * hung up.

variables.name: INCOMING_AUTO_REJECTED
variables.comment: * Indicates that incoming call was rejected by the modem before the call went in ringing

variables.name: SATELLITE_ENABLED
variables.comment: * Indicates that the call was unable to be made because the satellite modem is enabled.

methods.name: public static String toString(int cause)
methods.comment:
* Returns descriptive string for the specified disconnect cause.
     * @hide
